other_tests.findings: 30.1 sec, which is within the reference range of 25.0 to 36.5 sec.

The gallbladder contains several calcified gallstones and a 13 x 9 mm non-shadowing stone or sludge ball in the gallbladder neck or cystic duct. The gallbladder is distended, with no wall edema or pericholecystic fluid. The common duct measures 5 mm with no intra- or extra-hepatic bile duct dilatation.
